content:
HttpApplicationStateBase Class

In this Article

Serves as the base class for classes that enable information to be shared across multiple sessions and requests within an ASP.NET application.

Syntax

Declaration

public abstract class HttpApplicationStateBase : System.Collections.Specialized.NameObjectCollectionBase, System.Collections.ICollection

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • Object
  • System.Collections.Specialized.NameObjectCollectionBase
  • HttpApplicationStateBase

Remarks

The HttpApplicationStateBase class is an abstract class that contains the same members as the HttpApplicationState class. The HttpApplicationStateBase class lets you create derived classes that are like the HttpApplicationState class, but that you can customize and that work outside the ASP.NET pipeline. When you perform unit testing, you typically use a derived class to implement members with customized behavior that fulfills the scenario you are testing.

The HttpApplicationStateWrapper class derives from the HttpApplicationStateBase class. The HttpApplicationStateWrapper class serves as a wrapper for the HttpApplicationState class. At run time, you typically use an instance of the HttpApplicationStateWrapper class to call members of the HttpApplicationState object.

Constructors summary

HttpApplicationStateBase()

Initializes the class for use by an inherited class instance. This constructor can only be called by an inherited class.

Properties summary

AllKeys

When overridden in a derived class, gets the access keys for the objects in the collection.
Contents

When overridden in a derived class, gets a reference to the HttpApplicationStateBase object.
Count

When overridden in a derived class, gets the number of objects in the collection.
IsSynchronized

When overridden in a derived class, gets a value that indicates whether access to the collection is thread-safe.
Item(Int32)

When overridden in a derived class, gets a state object by index.
Item(String)

When overridden in a derived class, gets a state object by name.
StaticObjects

When overridden in a derived class, gets all objects that are declared by an object element where the scope is set to "Application" in the ASP.NET application.
SyncRoot

When overridden in a derived class, gets an object that can be used to synchronize access to the collection.

Methods summary

Add(String,Object)

When overridden in a derived class, adds a new object to the collection.
Clear()

When overridden in a derived class, removes all objects from the collection.
CopyTo(Array,Int32)

When overridden in a derived class, copies the elements of the collection to an array, starting at the specified index in the array.
Get(Int32)

When overridden in a derived class, gets a state object by index.
Get(String)

When overridden in a derived class, gets a state object by name.
GetEnumerator()

When overridden in a derived class, returns an enumerator that can be used to iterate through the collection.
GetKey(Int32)

When overridden in a derived class, gets the name of a state object by index.
Lock()

When overridden in a derived class, locks access to objects in the collection in order to enable synchronized access.
Remove(String)

When overridden in a derived class, removes the named object from the collection.
RemoveAll()

When overridden in a derived class, removes all objects from the collection.
RemoveAt(Int32)

When overridden in a derived class, removes a state object specified by index from the collection.
Set(String,Object)

When overridden in a derived class, updates the value of an object in the collection.
UnLock()

When overridden in a derived class, unlocks access to objects in the collection to enable synchronized access.

Constructors

  • HttpApplicationStateBase()

    Initializes the class for use by an inherited class instance. This constructor can only be called by an inherited class.

    protected HttpApplicationStateBase ();

Properties

  • AllKeys

    When overridden in a derived class, gets the access keys for the objects in the collection.

    public virtual string[] AllKeys { get; }

    Property Value

    • String[]

      An array of state object keys.

    Exceptions

    • NotImplementedException

      Always.

  • Contents

    When overridden in a derived class, gets a reference to the HttpApplicationStateBase object.

    public virtual System.Web.HttpApplicationStateBase Contents { get; }

    Property Value

    • HttpApplicationStateBase

      A reference to the HttpApplicationState object.

    Exceptions

    • NotImplementedException

      Always.

    Remarks

    This property provides compatibility with earlier versions of ASP.

  • Count

    When overridden in a derived class, gets the number of objects in the collection.

    public override int Count { get; }

    Property Value

    • Int32

      The number of objects in the collection.

    Exceptions

    • NotImplementedException

      Always.

  • IsSynchronized

    When overridden in a derived class, gets a value that indicates whether access to the collection is thread-safe.

    public virtual bool IsSynchronized { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if access is synchronized (thread-safe); otherwise, false.

    Exceptions

    • NotImplementedException

      Always.

  • Item(Int32)

    When overridden in a derived class, gets a state object by index.

    public virtual object this[int index] { get; }

    Parameters

    • index
      Int32

      The index of the object in the collection.

    Property Value

    • Object

      The object referenced by index.

    Exceptions

    • NotImplementedException

      Always.

  • Item(String)

    When overridden in a derived class, gets a state object by name.

    public virtual object this[string name] { get; set; }

    Parameters

    • name
      String

      The name of the object in the collection.

    Property Value

    • Object

      The object referenced by name.

    Exceptions

    • NotImplementedException

      Always.

  • StaticObjects

    When overridden in a derived class, gets all objects that are declared by an object element where the scope is set to "Application" in the ASP.NET application.

    public virtual System.Web.HttpStaticObjectsCollectionBase StaticObjects { get; }

    Property Value

    • HttpStaticObjectsCollectionBase

      A collection of objects in the application.

    Exceptions

    • NotImplementedException

      Always.

    Remarks

    Application objects are defined in the Global.asax file inside an element with syntax like the following:

    <object runat="server" scope="Application">Object information</object>

  • SyncRoot

    When overridden in a derived class, gets an object that can be used to synchronize access to the collection.

    public virtual object SyncRoot { get; }

    Property Value

    • Object

      An object that can be used to synchronize access to the collection.

    Exceptions

    • NotImplementedException

      Always.

    When overridden in a derived class, copies the elements of the collection to an array, starting at the specified index in the array.

    public virtual void CopyTo (Array array, int index);

    Parameters

    • array
      Array

      The one-dimensional array that is the destination for the elements that are copied from the collection. The array must have zero-based indexing.

    • index

    Exceptions

    • NotImplementedException

      Always.
